code: up_go_res   <- up_go(sig_df,   samples = "NM_vs_NWT") down_go_res <- down_go(sig_df, samples = "NM_vs_NWT") all_up_go   <- list() all_down_go <- list()  for (nm in names(res_sign)) {   df <- res_sign[[nm]]   if (nrow(df) == 0) next    if (any(df$sign == "Up")) {     all_up_go[[nm]] <- up_go(df, samples = nm)   }    if (any(df$sign == "Down")) {     all_down_go[[nm]] <- down_go(df, samples = nm)   } }

text: TranscripTools follows way actually work bulk RNA-seq projects: sanity-check global structure early (PCA/outliers/batch). define clean DEG set, refine (DE → pathway → genes). keep looping “global” “focused” views instead pretending analysis linear. export results consistent way, comparisons pile fast. ’re single contrast , can just write script. ’re many contrasts across projects, saves time keeps workflow readable.
